If the user provides any Special Instructions, prioritize them over the above guidelines.

# Task

You are given a markdown-formatted text `md`. Write a function `q_and_a_extractor` to extract all text in the markdown sections Question and Answer (starting with `# Question` and `# Answer`, respectively) and return the answer in a tuple like `(question,answer)`. Strip any leading spaces and newlines from the extracted text.



# Special Instructions

None.

```julia
using Markdown: parse_markdown

function q_and_a_extractor(md::String)
    parsed = parse_markdown(md)
    questions = findall(x -> occursin("# Question", x.text), parsed)
    answers = findall(x -> occursin("# Answer", x.text), parsed)

    results = Tuple{String, String}[]
    for (q_i, a_i) in zip(questions, answers)
        question = strip(parsed[q_i].text)
        answer = strip(parsed[a_i].text)
        push!(results, (question, answer))
    end
    return results
end
```

This function uses the `Markdown` package to parse the markdown text into an abstract syntax tree. It then finds all sections that start with `# Question` and `# Answer` using `findall` and extracts the corresponding text after stripping leading spaces and newlines. Finally, it returns a tuple of `(question, answer)` pairs for each question-answer section found in the markdown text.
